creature.name: Irkem Dresh
items: flintlock pistol (10 rounds; Pathfinder Guns & Gears 153)

mid.name: Defying Glare
mid.trigger: A creature uses a {@trait mental} effect against Dresh and fails or critically fails
entries: Dresh Demoralizes that creature; when she does, {@action Demoralize} loses the {@trait auditory} trait and gains the {@trait visual} trait and she doesn't take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand her language.

bot.name: Generous Distraction
entries: Dresh can use the promise of wealth to distract her foes. When she succeeds or critically succeeds on a {@skill Deception} check to {@action Feint} against a target within 30 feet, the target is {@condition flat-footed} against her ranged attacks as well as her melee Strikes.

bot.name: Silver Shower Shot
entries: Dresh throws {@dice 2d6} silver pieces into the air, potentially distracting her target. Dresh makes a {@skill Deception} check to {@action Feint} against a creature within 30 feet that can see her and which she can see. If her flintlock pistol is loaded, Dresh then makes a ranged flintlock pistol {@action Strike} against that target.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Dresh deals an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d6} piercing Melee{@as 1} sap +6 (agile, nonlethal), Damage {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning

mid.name: Weeping Wounds
entries: The fluid in a Sludgespine's pustules is harmful to other creatures. Whenever a creature hits a Sludgespine killer with a melee attack, the attacker must succeed at a DC 14 Reflex save or take 1 acid damage (2 acid damage on a critical failure).

bot.name: Pack Attack
entries: A gnoll deals {@damage 1d4} extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the gnoll's allies.

bot.name: Stealthy Abduction
entries: When a Sludgespine killer successfully Grapples a creature, that creature makes no sound; other creatures can't notice the grapple by hearing alone. As long as it's grappled, the creature can't use actions with the {@trait auditory} trait or cast spells with a verbal component.

mid.name: Verdant Burst
entries: When a follower of Shumfallow dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring {@dice 1d8} Hit Points to each fungus creature in a 30-foot emanation. This area is filled with fungi, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain is not a viable environment for this fungi, they wither after 24 hours.

bot.name: Change Shape
entries: The follower of Shumfallow transforms into a Small giant mushroom or patch of fungi. This ability otherwise uses the effects of tree shape.

bot.name: Pack Attack
entries: A follower of Shumfallow's Strikes deal an additional {@dice 1d4} damage to creatures that are within the reach of at least two of the follower's allies.

bot.name: Spores
entries: A creature that takes damage from a follower of Shumfallow's spore pod {@action Strike} must succeed at a DC 15 Fortitude save or take 1 {@condition persistent damage ||persistent poison damage}. A creature has its vision reduced as long as the {@condition persistent damage} continues and can see only within 20 feet (or 10 feet, on a critical failure).

mid.name: Weeping Wounds
entries: As Sludgespine killers (page 25).

bot.name: Pack Attack
entries: A gnoll deals {@damage 1d4} extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the gnoll's allies.

bot.name: Express Meal
entries: Bristlebane makes a whip {@action Strike} against one creature within reach, on a success she pulls the target into an adjacent square. This is forced movement. She then Strikes the pulled target with her jaws. Both attacks count against her multiple attack penalty but don't apply until after both attacks.

bot.name: Whip
entries: Whirlwind{@as 3} Bristlebane uses her whip to {@action Disarm}, {@action Strike}, or {@action Trip} each creature within her reach. She can select a different action for each target. She takes a –2 circumstance penalty on the check for each action, and each action counts against her multiple attack penalty, but her multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the actions.

attacks.name: alchemist's fire
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d8} fire plus 1 {@condition persistent damage ||persistent fire} plus 1 fire splash

mid.name: Blaze of Glory
mid.trigger: The Powderkeg Punk takes fire damage
entries: The Powderkeg Punk Demoralizes the creature that dealt the fire damage. {@action Demoralize} loses the {@trait auditory} trait and gains the {@trait visual} trait, and the Powderkeg Punk doesn't take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand their language. The Powderkeg Punk can use this reaction even if the triggering damage reduced the Punk to 0 Hit Points.

bot.name: Bombing Run
entries: The bombardier draws two bombs, and then Strides and makes two Strikes with a bomb before, after, or during the movement.

bot.name: Quick Bomber
entries: The bombardier can {@action Interact} to draw a bomb and then make a {@action Strike} with it.

bot.name: Shake It Up
entries: The bombardier shakes a bottle of alchemist's fire, and then Strikes with it. The radius of the splash damage for this {@action Strike} increases to 10 feet.

mid.name: Blaze of Glory
entries: As Powderkeg Punk bombardier (page 38).

bot.name: Gut Shot
bot.requirements: The gunner is flanked by two or more creatures and the gunner's pistol is loaded
entries: The gunner turns their pistol on themself and pulls the trigger, firing through their own gut to catch the foe behind them unawares.
The gunner makes a flintlock pistol {@action Strike} against an adjacent creature, who becomes {@condition flat-footed} against this {@action Strike}. The gunner takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The gunner deals an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

bot.name: Toss and Shoot
bot.requirements: The gunner is holding a loaded firearm
entries: The gunner Interacts to draw an alchemist's fire, throws it at a point within 30 feet, and then shoots the bomb in midair. Creatures within a 10-foot radius of the shot bomb must succeed at a DC 15 Reflex save or take the splash and {@condition persistent damage} from the alchemist's fire.

creature.name: Dewey Daystar

mid.name: Spiny Body
entries: A cactus leshy is covered in spines. A creature that Grabs the cactus leshy takes {@damage 1d8+3} piercing damage.

mid.name: Verdant Burst
entries: When Dewey Daystar dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from his body, restoring {@dice 2d8} Hit Points to each plant creature in a 30-foot emanation. This area fills with cacti, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain is not a viable environment for the cacti, they wither after 24 hours.

creature.description: Male cactus leshy bounty hunter (Pathfinder Bestiary 3 160)

bot.name: Firearms Critical Specialization
entries: When the gunmarshal makes a critical hit with a firearm, the target must succeed at a DC 18 Fortitude save or be {@condition stunned||stunned 1}.

bot.name: Lawbringer
entries: The gunmarshal marks a foe for judgment, granting the gunmarshal a +10-foot circumstance bonus to Speed when moving toward that creature.

top.name: Wind-Up
entries: 48 hours, DC 14, standby

bot.name: Salvage Ammunition
entries: The clockwork hunter gathers up any unattended crossbow bolts within reach and reloads its bolt launcher. The hunter restocks its supply of bolts, up to 10 bolts maximum.

bot.name: Skirmish Strike
entries: The clockwork hunter shuffles its feet and its weapon in tandem. It either Steps and then Strikes, or Strikes and then Steps.

bot.name: Target Weakness
entries: The clockwork hunter takes a moment to scan a creature for weaknesses, then Strikes with a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll. The hunter's {@action Strike} gains the deadly d4 trait for this attack.

top.name: Spotlight
entries: The clockwork handler can use the everburning torch built into its helmet to illuminate areas it's examining. Whenever it Seeks in a 30-foot cone and rolls a successful {@skill Perception} check, the clockwork handler gets a critical success instead.

top.name: Wind-Up
entries: 24 hours, DC 15, standby

bot.name: Hog-tie
bot.requirements: The clockwork handler has a creature {@condition restrained}
entries: The clockwork handler cuts a length of rope from the supply in its chassis to tie up the {@condition restrained} creature. The creature is {@condition restrained} until it

bot.name: Escapes or Forces
entries: Open the rope with a successful DC 15 check (typically an attack roll or {@skill Thievery} check to {@action Escape}, or an {@skill Athletics} check to {@action Force Open} the ropes; {@condition restrained} creatures don't take a –2 penalty on this check for not using a crowbar). The rope has Hardness 2 and 8 Hit Points (BT 4).

bot.name: Siren
entries: The clockwork handler emits a loud noise (such as a bell or highpitched mechanical scream) that can be easily heard by anyone within 500 feet. Creatures within 100 feet take a –2 circumstance penalty to {@skill Perception} checks that are hearing-based. Creatures within 30 feet who fail a DC 14 Fortitude save can't hear anything but the siren, critically fail {@skill Perception} checks that require hearing, and are immune to {@trait auditory} effects. This effect lasts until the creature leaves the area and for 1 round afterward.

top.name: Mini-Keg
entries: A clockwork brewer can hold up to 5 gallons of liquid in a built-in tank.
By default, this tank contains the clockwork brewer's beer.

top.name: Standard Greeting
entries: Clockwork brewers have a limited set of pre-recorded phrases they can use to interact with clientele, based on their instructions. The audio is recorded on an embedded gemstone worth 5 gp. Removing a gemstone from or installing a gemstone into a clockwork brewer requires a successful DC 18 {@skill Thievery} check to {@action Disable a Device}; on a failure, the gemstone is undamaged, but any recorded sounds are erased.

top.name: Wind-Up
entries: 24 hours, DC 18, standby

bot.name: Bottoms Up
bot.requirements: The clockwork brewer has a creature grappled
entries: The clockwork brewer forcefeeds the grappled creature 1 serving of whatever liquid is in the clockwork brewer's tank (typically beer such as Smokeside Sour; see sidebar). The creature is exposed to the liquid's effects, and it can't breathe or speak until the start of its turn.

bot.name: Pre-Programmed Greeting
entries: The clockwork brewer clearly delivers a disarmingly {@condition friendly} greeting to a creature within 30 feet. The creature attempts a DC 17 Will save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the clockwork brewer's next attack before the end of the brewer's next turn.
The target is then immune to Pre-Programmed Greeting for 1 day

top.name: Wind-Up
entries: 24 hours, DC 19, standby

bot.name: Constrict
bot.requirements: The clockwork fabricator has a creature grappled or {@condition restrained}; Effect {@damage 2d4+4} bludgeoning, DC 21 Modular Arms A clockwork fabricator is built to perform a specific type of task repeatedly, and it comes with built-in artisan's tools and two detachable "arms. " An adjacent creature can forcibly remove a clockwork fabricator's arm with a successful DC 18 {@skill Thievery} check to {@action Disable a Device}. A creature can {@action Interact} to install a new arm with a successful DC 18 {@skill Lore||Engineering Lore} check. A fabricator has two of any of the following types of arms.

items: Melee {@as 1} buzz-saw blade +16 (forceful, sweep), Damage {@damage 1d4+6} slashing plus {@damage 1d6} bleed
Melee {@as 1} crushing vise +14 (grapple), Damage {@damage 2d6+6} bludgeoning plus Grab
Ranged {@as 1} nail gun +11 (agile, range 10 feet), Damage {@damage 2d8} piercing
Ranged {@as 1} towing anchor +11 (thrown 30 feet), Damage {@damage 1d4+6} piercing

bot.name: Pull
bot.requirements: The clockwork fabricator's last action was a successful towing anchor {@action Strike}
entries: The clockwork fabricator reels in the anchor and attempts an {@skill Athletics} check against the target's Fortitude DC. On a success, the clockwork fabricator pulls the target into a free square adjacent to it. This movement is forced movement.

bot.name: Dirt
entries: Breath{@as 2} (arcane, earth, evocation) The prairie drake spits a ball of dirt that explodes into a shower of rocks and mud. The attack has a range of 30 feet and explodes in a 5-foot radius burst. Creatures within the burst take {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage (DC 16 basic Reflex save). Plant creatures in the area take no damage on a successful save; regardless, once per day, plant creatures can spend 10 minutes in the area to absorb the nutrients and heal {@dice 1d8} Hit Points. The prairie drake can't use Dirt Breath again for {@dice 1d6} rounds.

bot.name: Draconic Frenzy
entries: The prairie drake makes one jaws {@action Strike} and two wing Strikes in any order.

bot.name: Speed Surge
entries: The prairie drake Strides or Burrows twice.

top.name: Motion Sense
entries: A yeast ooze can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.

bot.name: Monstrous Yeast
entries: Whenever a creature infected with monstrous yeast takes cold damage, they can make a new saving throw with a +2 circumstance bonus.

attacks.name: pseudopod
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d6+5} bludgeoning plus rust and tetanus (Pathfinder Gamemastery Guide 118)

top.name: Motion Sense
entries: As yeast ooze.

mid.name: Corrode Weapon
mid.trigger: The rust ooze is hit with a metal weapon
entries: The rust ooze deals {@damage 2d6} acid damage to the item, ignoring its Hardness.

mid.name: Metal Resistance
entries: A rust ooze has resistance 5 to metal weapons.

bot.name: Rust
entries: When a rust ooze critically succeeds at a pseudopod {@action Strike}, it deals {@damage 2d6} acid damage to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring the item's Hardness. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against a rust ooze's pseudopod attack, the shield is automatically {@condition broken}, but no other item is rusted.

mid.name: Custom Armor
entries: Nixbrix's custom armor, which only he knows how to operate, grants him physical resistance. Once Nixbrix is reduced to fewer than half his Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, his custom armor breaks, causing the following effects: his

mid.name: Armor
entries: Class is reduced to 20, he loses his physical resistance, he can't use his really big gun, and his buzzsaw knuckles no longer cause {@condition persistent damage ||persistent bleed damage}.

mid.name: Leap Away
mid.trigger: Nixbrix is targeted with a ranged attack
entries: Nixbrix Leaps up to 10 feet vertically and 30 feet horizontally, and he gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

bot.name: Buzz-Saw Knuckles
entries: Nixbrix has custom-built knuckledusters called buzz-saw knuckles. Only he knows how to operate them.

bot.name: Escape Route
entries: Nixbrix flees the scene. He moves four times, each time using one of the following actions:

bot.name: Climb, Leap, Stand, Step, or Stride.
Really Big Gun
entries: Nixbrix has a custom-built, extra-large firearm mounted to the shoulder of his custom armor.

Only he knows how to fire the contraption, which is inscrutable in the hands of anyone else. Whenever Nixbrix fires his Really Big Gun, the armor automatically reloads the weapon, but it doesn't finish reloading until the end of his next turn. He can only fire it, at most, every other round. He can take 6 shots with this weapon before all the ammunition is spent.

bot.name: Knuckle Knock
entries: Nixbrix Strides, Climbs, or Leaps once, then Strikes with his buzz-saw knuckles. As long as this {@action Strike} is a success, he unleashes a devastating black powder explosion afterward that deals {@damage 1d6} fire damage to both him and the target of the {@action Strike}. He then Strides or Leaps once more, propelled by the blast.

top.name: Infused
entries: Items Shoma Lyzerius carries 2 moderate acid flasks, 2 moderate bottled lightnings, 2 lesser elixirs of life, 6 moderate lyzerium vials (see the Lyzerium sidebar on page 63), and 2 lesser tanglefoot bags. These items last for 24 hours, or until the next time he makes his daily preparations. He can spend an action to create an additional dose of any one of these items, or any of the items listed as formulas in his book.

bot.name: Far Lob
entries: Lyzerius's bombs have a range increment of 30 feet (instead of 20 feet).

bot.name: Firebug
entries: Lyzerius's alchemical items deal an additional 1 fire damage on a successful {@action Strike}.

bot.name: Natural-Born Burner
entries: Any melee weapon Lyzerius uses deals an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

bot.name: Quick Bomber
entries: Lyzerius can {@action Interact} to draw a bomb and then make a {@action Strike} with it.
